data.current_description: Create an OS policy assignment. This method also creates the first revision of the OS policy assignment. This method returns a long running operation (LRO) that contains the rollout details. The rollout can be cancelled by cancelling the LRO. For more information, see [Method: projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations.cancel](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/osconfig/rest/v1alpha/projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations/cancel).
data.summary_suggestion: Create OS policy assignment and initiate rollout
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new OS policy assignment and automatically generates its first revision. The assignment is applied to dynamically targeted Compute Engine VM instances based on the specified labels and filters. Returns a long-running operation (LRO) containing rollout details. The rollout can be monitored or cancelled via the returned operation. Requires OSPolicyAssignment request body with policy rules, instance filters, and target labels.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description mentions LRO and cancellation but lacks clarity on what the assignment does (applies policies to VMs), what inputs are required (OSPolicyAssignment schema), and the side effect of targeting VM instances. message: Operation 'osconfig.projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Original had no summary and description was confusing (stated 'creates a new revision' when deleting). Added clear summary indicating deletion action. Improved description to clarify that deletion is the primary action, explain LRO behavior, cancellation capability, and permanent deletion of revisions. Added input requirement clarity for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Delete the OS policy assignment. This method creates a new revision of the OS policy assignment. This method returns a long running operation (LRO) that contains the rollout details. The rollout can be cancelled by cancelling the LRO. If the LRO completes and is not cancelled, all revisions associated with the OS policy assignment are deleted. For more information, see [Method: projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations.cancel](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/osconfig/rest/v1alpha/projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations/cancel).
data.summary_suggestion: Delete OS policy assignment and rollout revisions
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the specified OS policy assignment and initiates a long-running operation (LRO) to rollout the deletion across all targeted VM instances. The operation can be cancelled using the cancel operation endpoint. Upon successful completion, all revisions associated with the OS policy assignment are permanently deleted. Returns an Operation resource containing rollout details. Requires the OS policy assignment name as input.
data.reasoning: Original had no summary and description was confusing (stated 'creates a new revision' when deleting). Added clear summary indicating deletion action. Improved description to clarify that deletion is the primary action, explain LRO behavior, cancellation capability, and permanent deletion of revisions. Added input requirement clarity for AI agent understanding.

data.summary_suggestion: Update OS policy assignment and trigger rollout
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing OS policy assignment with new configuration. This operation creates a new revision of the OS policy assignment and initiates a long-running operation (LRO) to rollout the changes to all targeted VM instances. The rollout can be cancelled using the cancel operation endpoint. Accepts an OSPolicyAssignment resource with updated policies. Returns an Operation resource containing rollout details and status. Side effects include creating a new assignment revision and modifying policy enforcement on targeted VMs.

data.current_description: Create an OS policy assignment. This method also creates the first revision of the OS policy assignment. This method returns a long running operation (LRO) that contains the rollout details. The rollout can be cancelled by cancelling the LRO. For more information, see [Method: projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations.cancel](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/osconfig/rest/v1alpha/projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations/cancel).
data.summary_suggestion: Create OS policy assignment and initiate rollout
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new OS policy assignment and automatically generates its first revision. The assignment is applied to dynamically targeted Compute Engine VM instances based on the specified labels and filters. Returns a long-running operation (LRO) containing rollout details. data.current_description: Delete the OS policy assignment. This method creates a new revision of the OS policy assignment. This method returns a long running operation (LRO) that contains the rollout details. The rollout can be cancelled by cancelling the LRO. If the LRO completes and is not cancelled, all revisions associated with the OS policy assignment are deleted. For more information, see [Method: projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations.cancel](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/osconfig/rest/v1alpha/projects.locations.osPolicyAssignments.operations/cancel).
data.summary_suggestion: Delete OS policy assignment and rollout revisions
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the specified OS policy assignment and initiates a long-running operation (LRO) to rollout the deletion across all targeted VM instances. The operation can be cancelled using the cancel operation endpoint. Upon successful completion, all revisions associated with the OS policy assignment are permanently deleted. Returns an Operation resource containing rollout details. Requires the OS policy assignment name as input.
data.reasoning: Original had no summary and description was confusing (stated 'creates a new revision' when deleting). Added clear summary indicating deletion action.
